This room is in a neat old building that is in an area with a lot of activity. There is an obvious move to revitalize the area, and it is neat to see.
You can walk right out the door, and down to the river! There is a path that follows the river for walking or biking, and if you want to go across the river, the bridge is one block away. There are numerous restaurants one block away, or more across the river. All of them are within walking distance.
Parking is easy right outside on the street, and the neighborhood feels very safe. It is very quiet! Take a walk around - there are some amazing houses right around the corner!
Check-in was easy with the code on the doors, and Larry's instructions were clear.
The room was what I would call hobo-chic. There's no pretense of trying to make it look like a high-end suite with the construction. It is very clean and neat. The decor is very tasteful and comfortable. The bathroom had fantastic lighting, and the water pressure in the shower/tub was great.
In an attempt to be environmentally aware, I'm sure, there are not a lot of extra towels available. I don't blame him because whatever is in the room will have to be washed, used or not, so why be wasteful. However, Larry is quick to respond to your questions and requests, so don't be afraid to ask for more of anything.
He included a $10 gift card for the restaurant around the corner for breakfast. Don't throw that away! The restaurant is wonderful!
